keel.Dataset

Class Attribute

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Dataset.Attribute

  • public class Attribute
extends java.lang.Object

    Attribute

    It contains an attribute representation. The class attributes are enough to descrive completly an attribute: name, type, possible values, minimums and maximums, etc. It offers a collection of functions to get all this information.
    Version:
    keel0.1
    Author:
    Albert Orriols Puig

      • enlargeBounds

        public void enlargeBounds(double value)
        It does enlarge the attribute bounds
        Parameters:
        value - is the value read from the BD file

      • rectifyValueInBounds

        public double rectifyValueInBounds(double value)
        It update an integer or real value read for an attribute in the test set if it doesn't match with the bounds defined in the train set. In this case, it replaces the value read for the nearliest bound (the minimum or the maximim bound respectively)
        Parameters:
        value - is the value read from the test file.
        Returns:
        a double with the rectified value.

      • isInBounds

        public boolean isInBounds(double val)
        It does check if the value passed as an argument is bounded by the [min, max] interval.
        Parameters:
        val - value to check.
        Returns:
        a boolean that indicates if the value is bounded.
